name: Shelf Engine
headline: Transforms how grocery stores buy highly perishable foods.
description: Shelf Engine helps businesses increase sales by accurately predicting the perfect amount of perishable goods to order, thus reducing food waste.

## Over 40% of deli sandwiches go to waste
Shelf Engine solves a grocery buyer’s costliest problem: accurately predicting orders for hundreds of fresh items every single day.
[Optimize your grocery ordering](http://www.shelfengine.com/<#>)
![](https://www.shelfengine.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/08/home-hero_sandwiches-1-768x347.png)
## More than 14% of fresh juice spoils
Shelf Engine grocery supply chain solutions generate the perfect order for every SKU, reduce out-of-stocks that erode shopper loyalty, and eliminate shrink that costs you money.
[Increase your grocery sales](http://www.shelfengine.com/<#>)
![](https://www.shelfengine.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/07/juice-01-768x470.png)
## And 35% of bread goes unsold
Unlike other demand planning solutions, Shelf Engine automates the entire ordering process. This frees up labor requirements for tasks that add value to the customer experience. 
[Place the perfect order](http://www.shelfengine.com/<#>)
![](https://www.shelfengine.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/07/home-hero_bread-768x408.png)
## **Full shelves. Fresh food.****Loyal customers.**
Shelf Engine intelligent forecasting uses your store’s daily sales data, along with real world considerations like local events, holidays, and weather, to generate perfect, profit-maximizing orders for each product, every day.
  * ![](https://www.shelfengine.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/features-1-1.svg)
### Completely automated ordering
Orders are automatically submitted to suppliers on your behalf. No scanning SKUs, overriding CAO suggestions, or guessing games. You have enough on your plate.
  * ![](https://www.shelfengine.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/features-2.svg)
### Reduce shrink
Shelf Engine accurately forecasts customer demand, which helps you get a handle on your shrink and reduce waste. That’s a win-win for your bottom line and the planet. 
  * ![](https://www.shelfengine.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/features-3.svg)
### Minimize stockouts
Few things send shoppers out your door empty-handed like out-of-stocks. Shelf Engine helps you keep your shelves fully stocked to increase sales and customer happiness.


> ## “Not only has Shelf Engine had an incredible impact on our sales, but these benefits have extended far beyond our shelves. With less time spent on forecasting and inventory planning, we’re able to spend more time focused on what matters most: our customers.”
> -Robin Brett, Director of Purchasing at Kimberton Whole Foods
## Are you leading or following the grocery tech transformation?
Discover how Shelf Engine gives early adopters a competitive edge. Co-Founder and CEO Stefan Kalb and John Burry, strategy and partnerships, explain how Shelf Engine’s solution enhances efficiency and profits for grocers.
Hear what makes Shelf Engine unique.
[ ](http://www.shelfengine.com/<https:/www.shelfengine.com/case-study-national-grocer/>)

## Over 40% of deli sandwiches go to waste
Shelf Engine solves a grocery buyer’s costliest problem: accurately predicting orders for hundreds of fresh items every single day.
Optimize your grocery ordering⟨22⟩
![](https://www.shelfengine.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/08/home-hero_sandwiches-1-768x347.png)
## More than 14% of fresh juice spoils
Shelf Engine grocery supply chain solutions generate the perfect order for every SKU, reduce out-of-stocks that erode shopper loyalty, and eliminate shrink that costs you money.
Increase your grocery sales⟨22⟩
![](https://www.shelfengine.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/07/juice-01-768x470.png)
## And 35% of bread goes unsold
Unlike other demand planning solutions, Shelf Engine automates the entire ordering process. This frees up labor requirements for tasks that add value to the customer experience. 
Place the perfect order⟨22⟩
![](https://www.shelfengine.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/07/home-hero_bread-768x408.png)
## **Full shelves. Fresh food.****Loyal customers.**
Shelf Engine intelligent forecasting uses your store’s daily sales data, along with real world considerations like local events, holidays, and weather, to generate perfect, profit-maximizing orders for each product, every day.
  * ![](https://www.shelfengine.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/features-1-1.svg)
### Completely automated ordering
Orders are automatically submitted to suppliers on your behalf. No scanning SKUs, overriding CAO suggestions, or guessing games. You have enough on your plate.
  * ![](https://www.shelfengine.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/features-2.svg)
### Reduce shrink
Shelf Engine accurately forecasts customer demand, which helps you get a handle on your shrink and reduce waste. That’s a win-win for your bottom line and the planet. 
  * ![](https://www.shelfengine.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/features-3.svg)
### Minimize stockouts
Few things send shoppers out your door empty-handed like out-of-stocks. Shelf Engine helps you keep your shelves fully stocked to increase sales and customer happiness.


> ## “Not only has Shelf Engine had an incredible impact on our sales, but these benefits have extended far beyond our shelves. With less time spent on forecasting and inventory planning, we’re able to spend more time focused on what matters most: our customers.”
> -Robin Brett, Director of Purchasing at Kimberton Whole Foods
## Are you leading or following the grocery tech transformation?
Discover how Shelf Engine gives early adopters a competitive edge. Co-Founder and CEO Stefan Kalb and John Burry, strategy and partnerships, explain how Shelf Engine’s solution enhances efficiency and profits for grocers.
Hear what makes Shelf Engine unique.
 ⟨26⟩

## Could you be selling more and wasting less?
We’ll analyze your data to help you spot ways to optimize your supply chain.
Find out how⟨27⟩

generated_description:
**Shelf Engine: Revolutionizing Grocery Supply Chains**

Founded in 2016 and hailing from Seattle, WA, Shelf Engine is on a mission to transform how grocery stores manage their highly perishable inventory. The company aims to minimize food waste by leveraging machine learning to predict the optimal quantity of perishable goods each store should order. They believe that with better data, grocery retailers can reduce waste and enhance their bottom line. 

As part of the Y Combinator S18 batch, Shelf Engine comes equipped with the fine-tuned capabilities of a tech startup that’s serious about solving a significant problem: over 40% of deli sandwiches and a staggering 35% of bread go to waste due to poor inventory management. Their AI-driven solutions not only streamline this ordering process but also free up valuable employee time to focus more on customer service rather than spend it wrestling with inventory forecasts.

With a team of 40 talented individuals, Shelf Engine has developed an intelligent forecasting system that factors in daily sales data, local events, and even weather patterns. This ensures that each product ordered is as close to perfect as it can get, thus minimizing stockouts and maximizing sales opportunities. Their approach doesn’t just boost retail efficiency—it’s also a win for consumers who benefit from fresher, better-stocked shelves.

Under the leadership of co-founder and CEO Stefan Kalb, the company is backed by partners like Nan and a strong strategy team. Together, they operate on the firm belief that reducing food waste is not just good business; it’s essential for our environment. 

For grocery retailers looking to gain an edge in a competitive market, Shelf Engine offers a compelling case: why follow conventional methods when you can lead with data-driven insights? By simplifying the complex world of grocery supply, they provide a clear path towards increased sales, reduced waste, and ultimately, a more sustainable grocery ecosystem.

Explore more at their [website](http://www.shelfengine.com), or consider their insights if you're in any food-related field looking to innovate your approach to supply chain management.
